qas.question: Termites are considered what type of insect?
Termites, bees, wasps, and what other insect are social insects?
What is another term for social insect?
Social insects live in well organized what?
The method that a bee dances is called what?

context: <a0_0>Social<a0_0/> insects, such as termites, <a1_0>ants<a1_0/> and many bees and wasps, are the most familiar species of <a2_0>eusocial animal<a2_0/>. They live together in large well-organized <a3_0>colonies<a3_0/> that may be so tightly integrated and genetically similar that the colonies of some species are sometimes considered superorganisms. It is sometimes argued that the various species of honey bee are the only invertebrates (and indeed one of the few non-human groups) to have evolved a system of abstract symbolic communication where a behavior is used to represent and convey specific information about something in the environment. In this communication system, called <a4_0>dance language<a4_0/>, the angle at which a bee dances represents a direction relative to the sun, and the length of the dance represents the distance to be flown.:309–311 Though perhaps not as advanced as honey bees, bumblebees also potentially have some social communication behaviors. Bombus terrestris, for example, exhibit a faster learning curve for visiting unfamiliar, yet rewarding flowers, when they can see a conspecific foraging on the same species.
